gcci.text: With the average H100 spot price pinned near $3.20/hr, chip availability is improving but buyers still face allocation bottlenecks, prompting tier-1 cloud providers to diversify suppliers and structure capex through joint ventures rather than spot purchasing.

gtpi.text: At an average input price of $1.25 per million tokens, API price wars are compressing margins, making throughput and efficiency the differentiators as providers invest in sparsity, KV-cache optimization, and specialized hardware to win model competition.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load indicates sustained grid strain that is accelerating behind-the-meter generation and nuclear adoption to curb carbon intensity while stabilizing data center power procurement.

aipi.text: Hardware costs easing toward ~$3.20/hr for H100 and API rates averaging ~$1.25 per million tokens are sustaining rapid model deployment, but a 120 TWh energy footprint and capex commitments elevate bubble and sustainability risks.
